text: lemon chickpeas tomatoes parsley these
are all sunny Mediterranean flavors that
are gonna give this chickpea and
dandelion salad a burst of freshness and
it's packed with protein between the
chickpeas and the quinoa so you
certainly won't miss meat on this meal I
have a lemon here a zest the whole thing
first into a bowl do it right over the
bowl because the oils from the zest will
be released and impart flavor into that
dressing and this also gets a few
tablespoons of juice you can measure but
I like to eyeball it's one less dish and
it's faster these things here are handy
if you don't have one I recommend it
they really do a good job of extracting
all of that citrus juice and that looks
like just about two tablespoons right
there this also is going to get olive
oil you can whisk this in again I'm
eyeballing but you can measure about 3
tablespoons this is already so fragrant
from the lemon it's amazing how quickly
this comes together and season
generously with salt and crushed red
pepper flakes you can use as much or as
little as you want if you aren't a fan
of kete like this you can just simply
use black pepper and rinse and drain a
can of chickpeas or if you're up for it
soak and cook your own give this a good
stir and now for something fresh and
green flat leaf parsley just a quick
chop here
don't finely chop your herbs especially
something like parsley it really just
destroys the flavor so I just do a quick
coarse chop like that and about a
tablespoon mmm I'm already ready to eat
this another stir and this should
marinate at room temperature for about
30 minutes you could also do this a day
or two ahead just keep it in the fridge
and pull it out to bring it to room
temperature before you compose your
salad okay now for the meat and potatoes
I have 1/2 a cup of cooked quinoa here
if you're not familiar with it it has
more protein than any other grain on
earth also 1/2 a cup of toasted almonds
I like them deeply toasted like this
really brings out their nutty rich
flavor and scallions 2 of them this is a
gentle onion that's gonna impart a lot
of flavor into the salad and
balance out the other flavors so just
give this a quick chop these are so
gorgeous
I found a lot of beautiful produce at
the farmers market about 1/4 cup not too
much that goes in as well
and look at these gorgeous dandelion
greens roots and all great to buy your
greens with roots when you can they'll
hold longer in your fridge you could
also use watercress arugula here they're
also peppery but I like dandelion greens
because they have a crisp tenderness the
smaller and more tender the greens the
gentler the flavor and beautiful cherry
tomatoes also from the farmers market
and remember those chickpeas we
marinated earlier well they've been
sitting and soaking up you can see how
gorgeous these are
give these another toss and they can go
into the bowl too yum yum yum now it's
important here to give the salad a taste
once you've tossed it to make sure
you've got enough salt enough oil enough
